content: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) in Java is a programming paradigm that focuses on organizing code into objects that contain data and methods. OOP allows for the reusability, modularity, and scalability of code, making it a fundamental concept in Java programming. This lesson will cover the core principles of OOP in Java, key components such as classes and objects, real-world applications, common challenges, best practices, code examples, connections to related concepts, and a summary of key takeaways.
